s-1.ptxt: ASSEMBLE DIFFERENTIAL CASE

s2.ptxt: Install the side gear thrust washer to the side gear.

atten4.ptxt: Using the table below, select 2 thrust washers which will ensure that the backlash is within the specifications.

s2.ptxt: Install the 2 side gears (with thrust washers), 2 pinion gears, 2 pinion gear thrust washers and pinion shaft to the differential case.

atten4.ptxt: Align the holes of the differential case and pinion shaft.

s2.ptxt: Measure the side gear backlash.

s3.ptxt: Using a dial indicator, measure the side gear backlash while holding one pinion gear toward the differential case.

item.ptxt: If the backlash is not as specified, install 2 side gear thrust washers with different thicknesses.

s2.ptxt: Using a pin punch and hammer, tap in the straight pin through the differential case and hole of the pinion shaft.
Stake the differential case.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL DIFFERENTIAL RING GEAR

s2.ptxt: Clean the contact surfaces of the differential case and ring gear.
Heat the ring gear in boiling water that is approximately 100°C (212°F).
Carefully remove the ring gear from the boiling water.
After the moisture on the ring gear has completely evaporated, quickly align the matchmarks on the ring gear and differential case and install the ring gear to the differential case.
Temporarily install 5 new lock plates and the 10 bolts.
After the ring gear cools down, diametrically tighten the 10 bolts uniformly in several passes.
Using a chisel and hammer, stake the 5 lock plates.

atten4.ptxt: Strike the tab labeled A so that it is flush with the flat surface of the bolt. Strike the tab labeled B so that half of the tab contacts the bolt as shown in the illustration.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR DIFFERENTIAL CASE BEARING

s2.ptxt: Using SST and a press, press the 2 case bearings (inner) onto the differential case.

s-1.ptxt: INSPECT DIFFERENTIAL RING GEAR RUNOUT

s2.ptxt: Install the differential case and 2 case bearings (outer) to the carrier, and install the 2 adjusting nuts so that there is no play in the bearing.
Install the 2 bearing caps with the 4 bolts.
Using a dial indicator, measure the runout of the ring gear.
If the runout exceeds the specified maximum value, remove the ring gear and check the runout of the differential case.
Remove the 4 bolts, 2 bearing caps, 2 adjusting nuts and differential case.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR DRIVE PINION FRONT TAPERED ROLLER BEARING

s2.ptxt: Using SST and a press, press the bearing (outer) into the carrier.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR DRIVE PINION REAR TAPERED ROLLER BEARING

s2.ptxt: Using SST and a press, press the bearing (outer) into the carrier.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR DRIVE PINION REAR TAPERED ROLLER BEARING

s2.ptxt: Install the plate washer to the drive pinion.

atten4.ptxt: First, install a washer that has the same thickness as the removed washer. After checking the tooth contact pattern, replace the washer with one of a different thickness if necessary.

s2.ptxt: Using SST and a press, press the bearing (inner) onto the drive pinion.

s-1.ptxt: ADJUST DIFFERENTIAL DRIVE PINION PRELOAD

s2.ptxt: Install the drive pinion, bearing (inner) and oil slinger.

atten4.ptxt: Install the spacer and oil seal after adjusting the gear contact pattern.

s2.ptxt: Using SST, install the companion flange.

atten3.ptxt: Before using SST (center bolt), apply hypoid gear oil to its threads and tip.

s2.ptxt: Adjust the drive pinion preload by installing the drive pinion nut.
Using SST to hold the companion flange in place, tighten the nut.

item.ptxt: As there is no spacer, tighten a little at a time. Be careful not to overtighten the nut.
Apply hypoid gear oil LSD to drive pinion thread and nut seat face.

s2.ptxt: Using a torque wrench, measure the preload.

entry.ptxt: 1.4 to 2.0 N*m (15 to 20 kgf*cm, 13 to 17 in.*lbf)
0.6 to 0.9 N*m (7 to 9 kgf*cm, 6 to 7 in.*lbf)

item.ptxt: For a more accurate measurement, rotate the bearing forward and backward several times before measuring.
Record the differential drive pinion preload for the total preload measurement.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL DIFFERENTIAL CASE ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Install the differential case and 2 case bearings (outer) to the differential carrier.

atten4.ptxt: Make sure the 2 case bearings (outer) are not interchanged.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR DIFFERENTIAL BEARING ADJUSTING NUT

s2.ptxt: Install the 2 adjusting nuts to the carrier, making sure the nuts are threaded properly.

s-1.ptxt: INSPECT AND ADJUST DIFFERENTIAL RING GEAR AND DIFFERENTIAL DRIVE PINION BACKLASH

s2.ptxt: Align the matchmarks on the caps and carrier.
Install the right and left bearing caps with the 4 bolts.

item.ptxt: If the bearing cap does not fit tightly on the carrier, the adjusting nuts are not threaded properly.

atten4.ptxt: Reinstall the adjusting nuts if necessary.

s2.ptxt: Loosen the 4 bearing cap bolts to the point where the adjusting nuts can be turned by SST.
Using SST, tighten the adjusting nut on the ring gear side until the ring gear has a backlash of about 0.2 mm (0.00787 in.).
While turning the ring gear, use SST to fully tighten the adjusting nut on the drive pinion side. After the bearings have settled, loosen the adjusting nut on the drive pinion side.
Using SST, tighten the adjusting nut 1 to 1.5 notches from the 0 preload position.
Using a dial indicator, adjust the ring gear backlash until it is within the specification.

item.ptxt: The backlash is adjusted by turning the left and right adjusting nuts by an equal amount. For example, loosen the nut on the right side one notch and loosen the nut on the left side one notch.
Perform the measurement at 3 or more positions around the circumference of the ring gear.

s2.ptxt: Tighten the bearing cap bolts.

s-1.ptxt: INSPECT TOTAL PRELOAD

s2.ptxt: Using a torque wrench, measure the preload with the teeth of the drive pinion and ring gear in contact.

entry.ptxt: 0.4 to 0.5 N*m (4 to 6 kgf*cm, 4 to 5 in.*lbf) + drive pinion preload
0.4 to 0.5 N*m (4 to 6 kgf*cm, 4 to 5 in.*lbf) + drive pinion preload

s2.ptxt: If the result is not as specified, adjust the preload.

atten3.ptxt: Record the differential ring gear preload.

s-1.ptxt: INSPECT TOOTH CONTACT BETWEEN RING GEAR AND DRIVE PINION

s2.ptxt: Coat 3 or 4 teeth at 3 different positions on the ring gear with Prussian blue.
Hold the companion flange firmly in place and rotate the ring gear in both directions.
Inspect the tooth contact pattern.

item.ptxt: If the teeth are not contacting properly, use the following chart to select a proper washer.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR DRIVE PINION NUT

s2.ptxt: Using SST and a hammer, loosen the staked part of the nut.
Using SST to hold the companion flange in place, remove the nut.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR DRIVE PINION COMPANION FLANGE SUB-ASSEMBLY WITH DUST DEFLECTOR

s2.ptxt: Using SST, remove the companion flange with dust deflector.

atten3.ptxt: Before using SST (center bolt), apply hypoid gear oil to its threads and tip.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR DIFFERENTIAL DRIVE PINION OIL SLINGER

s2.ptxt: Remove the oil slinger from the drive pinion.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR DRIVE PINION FRONT TAPERED ROLLER BEARING

s2.ptxt: Using SST, remove the roller bearing (inner) from the drive pinion.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR DIFFERENTIAL DRIVE PINION BEARING SPACER

s2.ptxt: Install a new bearing spacer.

atten4.ptxt: Make sure the spacer is installed correctly.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR DRIVE PINION FRONT TAPERED ROLLER BEARING

s2.ptxt: Install the bearing (inner) to the drive pinion.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR DIFFERENTIAL DRIVE PINION OIL SLINGER

s2.ptxt: Install the oil slinger to the drive pinion.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR DIFFERENTIAL CARRIER OIL SEAL

s2.ptxt: Apply MP grease to the lip of the oil seal.
Using SST and a hammer, tap in a new oil seal.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR DRIVE PINION COMPANION FLANGE SUB-ASSEMBLY WITH DUST DEFLECTOR

s2.ptxt: Using SST, install the companion flange with dust deflector.

atten3.ptxt: Before using SST (center bolt), apply hypoid gear oil to its threads and tip.

s2.ptxt: Apply hypoid gear oil LSD to drive pinion thread and nut seat face.
Using SST to hold the companion flange in place, install a new nut.

s-1.ptxt: INSPECT TOTAL PRELOAD

s2.ptxt: Using a torque wrench, measure the preload.

entry.ptxt: 1.5 to 2.1 N*m (15 to 21 kgf*cm, 14 to 19 in.*lbf) + ring gear preload
0.7 to 1.0 N*m (7 to 10 kgf*cm, 6 to 9 in.*lbf) + ring gear preload

item.ptxt: If necessary, disassemble and inspect the differential.

s-1.ptxt: INSPECT DIFFERENTIAL RING GEAR BACKLASH

s2.ptxt: Using a dial indicator, check the backlash of the ring gear.

item.ptxt: If the backlash is not as specified, adjust the side bearing preload or perform repairs as necessary.

atten4.ptxt: Perform the measurement at 3 or more positions around the circumference of the ring gear.

s-1.ptxt: INSPECT REAR DRIVE PINION COMPANION FLANGE SUB-ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Using a dial indicator, measure the runout of the companion flange vertically and laterally.

item.ptxt: If the runout is more than the maximum, replace the companion flange.

s-1.ptxt: STAKE DRIVE PINION NUT

s2.ptxt: Using a chisel and hammer, stake the nut.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL REAR DIFFERENTIAL BEARING ADJUSTING NUT LOCK

s2.ptxt: Install 2 new adjusting nut locks to the bearing caps with the 2 bolts.
Bend the nut locks.
